Views.GetstartedViewType.description: The Declarative Resource Overview blade is is the home page for your resource, which provides the purpose, top actions and key information so that users can quickly get value from your resource.

Views.PropertiesViewType.description: The Properties view is used to showcase resource-specific properties that are frequently accessed by users for the given resource. It can be used as a standalone properties view or as one of the tabs in a resource overview. The Properties view supports adding Secret and Date formats for secure string and datetime values respectively. It also supports adding sourceUnits and maximumFractionDigits for number value. SourceUnits indicates the unit of the original value. MaximumFractionDigits indicates the maximum fraction digits for the display value. The correct display unit is then automatically calculated. For example, if the original value is 1,363,148 SI bytes, and you specify source unit as `Bytes_SI` and MaximumFractionDigits as 1, the display string will be 1.3 GB. Properties view also supports adding an action link to an URL, a resource or a blade. You can learn more about the design pattern for properties [here](design-patterns-resource-manage.md#-example-properties-content-).

Views.MonitoringViewType.description: The Monitoring view is used to display the most useful resource-specific charts and metrics. The metrics are derived from Azure Monitor.

Views.CapabilitiesViewType.description: The Capabilities view is used to highlight valuable features of a resource that are not part of the Get Started or Properties content.

Views.RecommendationsViewType.description: The Recommendations view is used to show the active Azure Advisor recommendations for the resource.

Views.TutorialsViewType.description: The Tutorials view is used to display the most useful resource-specific Microsoft training, videos, and useful links to “How to…” documents.

Views.DataBrowseViewType.description: The Data Browse view is used to display the array data in a table.

Views.GetStartedGetStartedTab.description: The Getting Started view is the primary view that users first see in Declarative Resource Overview blade.

defaultSnippets.label: GetStartedDataBrowseTab
defaultSnippets.description: Default snippet for Data Browse Tab

Views.GetStartedDataBrowseTab.description: The Data Browse view is used to display the array data in a table.

Views.GetStartedPropertiesTab.description: The Properties view is used to showcase resource-specific properties that are frequently accessed by users for the given resource. It can be used as a standalone properties view or as one of the tabs in a resource overview. The Properties view supports adding Secret and Date formats for secure string and datetime values respectively. It also supports adding sourceUnits and maximumFractionDigits for number value. SourceUnits indicates the unit of the original value. MaximumFractionDigits indicates the maximum fraction digits for the display value. The correct display unit is then automatically calculated. For example, if the original value is 1,363,148 SI bytes, and you specify source unit as `Bytes_SI` and MaximumFractionDigits as 1, the display string will be 1.3 GB. Properties view also supports adding an action link to an URL, a resource or a blade. You can learn more about the design pattern for properties [here](design-patterns-resource-manage.md#-example-properties-content-).

Views.GetStartedMonitoringTab.description: The Monitoring view is used to display the most useful resource-specific charts and metrics.

Views.GetStartedRecommendationsTab.description: The Recommendations view is used to show the active Azure Advisor recommendations for the resource.

Views.GetStartedTutorialsTab.description: The Tutorials view is used to display the most useful resource-specific Microsoft training, videos, and useful links to "How to…" documents.

Views.GetStartedInfoTab.description: The Information view allows you to specify an array of actions including URL, Blade and Menu open actions.

Views.ViewTypeParameters.description: Declarative views, like any other Portal blade supports parameters. The parameters need to be declared in the parameters section of the view. See the samples below for an example

Views.ViewTypeCommands.description: Array of command items to render in the command bar of the view.

Views.CommandBase.description: All common properties used in commands

Views.BladeReferenceWithContextPane.description: open a blade in context pane

Views.GettingStartedInfoCardReference.description: Defines a card for the InfoTab in the GetStarted View.

Views.AutogenFormViewType.description: The AutogenForm view lets you convert ARM template to Form view and deploy a resource.

Views.FormViewType.description: The declarative form view lets you author a form in the portal. Form view can be used as a full screen blade, or in a context pane. A form view can be used for the following three scenarios - 1. Deploy an ARM template (Option 1 in the Properties section below) 2. Perform an ARM call (Option 2 in the Properties section below) 3. Return a list of output to the caller blade. (Option 3 in the Properties section below) Form view supports tabbed forms, sequential forms (wizards) and simple forms without tabs. When used to deploy an ARM template, it provides the last review and create tab and the post-create experience automatically. You can specify form parameters, resources, title as on any other blade. Forms is a more advanced, newer version of CreateUiDefinition with significant additional capabilities.

Views.FormSteps.description: For single step, specify only one formStep. For multi steps, specify many steps.

Views.Microsoft.Common.ManagementGroupSe.description: Individual control for selecting management group

allOf.description: A control for displaying your current tenant. A tenant represents an organization and is a dedicated dedicated instance of Azure AD that an organization or app developer receives at the beginning of a relationship with Microsoft.

Views.Microsoft.Common.SubscriptionSelec.description: The subscription selector element lets user to select subscription from subscriptions list

Views.Microsoft.Common.ResourceGroupSele.description: Individual scope picker for resource groups, supports creating a new resource group, using an existing one or both

Views.Microsoft.Common.LocationSelector.description: The location selector should be used to select a Azure region. However, in the basics tab, for the primary region for a resource, use the resource scope control instead.

defaultSnippets.label: Microsoft.Compute.CredentialsCombo for Linux
defaultSnippets.description: Default snippet for Microsoft.Compute.CredentialsCombo for Linux

defaultSnippets.label: Microsoft.Compute.CredentialsCombo for Windows
defaultSnippets.description: Default snippet for Microsoft.Compute.CredentialsCombo for Windows

Views.Microsoft.Common.CheckBox.description: The CheckBox control lets users check or uncheck an option. The control returns **true** when the control is checked or **false** when not checked.

Views.Microsoft.Common.DatePicker.description: A control for selecting a date and time value

Views.Microsoft.Common.DropDown.description: A selection control with a dropdown list. You can allow selection of only a single item or multiple items. You can also optionally include a description with the items.

Views.Microsoft.Common.EditableGrid.description: A control for gathering tabular input. All fields within the grid are editable and the number of rows may vary.

Views.Microsoft.Common.Grid.description: The Grid control supports both inline and using a blade for gathering input.

Views.Microsoft.Common.FileUpload.description: A control that allows a user to specify one or more files to upload.

Views.Microsoft.Common.OptionsGroup.description: The OptionsGroup control lets users select one option from two or more choices. A user can select only one option.

Views.Microsoft.Common.PasswordBox.description: A control that can be used to provide and confirm a password.

Views.Microsoft.Common.ResourceScope.description: ResourceScope control provides resource scope selectors and resource name field as one control.

Views.Microsoft.Common.Selector.description: The Selector component enables a user to select items defined by using BladeInvokeControl.

Views.Microsoft.Solutions.BladeInvokeCon.description: BladeInvokeControl let user to invoke another blade from different control element. Cannot be used alone. Commonly used with other controls, such as Microsoft.Common.Selector.

Views.Microsoft.Common.Section.description: The Section component enables a user to group other controls into a section.

Views.Microsoft.Common.Slider.description: The Slider control lets users select from a range of allowed values.

Views.Microsoft.Common.TagsByResource.description: A control for associating [tags](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-resource-manager/management/tag-resources?tabs=json) with the resources in a deployment.

Views.Microsoft.Common.TextBlock.description: A control that can be used to add text to the portal interface. This control is a read only control that does not take any input and renders text.

Views.Microsoft.Common.TextBox.description: The TextBox component enables a user to type text into an app. It's typically used to capture a single line of text, but can be configured to capture multiple lines of text. The text displays on the screen in a simple, uniform format.

Views.Microsoft.Compute.CredentialsCombo.description: A group of controls with built-in validation for passwords and SSH public keys.
A  controls with built-in validation for passwords.

Views.Microsoft.Compute.SizeSelector.description: A control for selecting a size for one or more virtual machine instances.

Views.Microsoft.Compute.UserNameTextBox.description: A text box control with built-in validation for Windows and Linux user names.

Views.Microsoft.KeyVault.KeyVaultCertifi.description: A control for selecting a key vault certificate.

Views.Microsoft.ManagedIdentity.Identity.description: A control for assigning [managed identities](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/managed-identities-azure-resources/overview) for a resource in a deployment.

Views.Microsoft.Network.PublicIpAddressC.description: A control that can be used for selecting an existing public IP address or creating a new one.

Views.Microsoft.Network.VirtualNetworkCo.description: A group of controls for selecting a new or existing virtual network.

Views.Microsoft.Solutions.ArmApiControl.description: ArmApiControl lets you get results from an Azure Resource Manager API operation. Use the results to populate dynamic content in other controls.

Views.Microsoft.Solutions.GraphApiContro.description: GraphApiControl is a RESTful web API that enables you to access Microsoft Cloud service resources.

Views.Microsoft.Solutions.ResourceSelect.description: ResourceSelector lets users select an existing resource from a subscription.

Views.Microsoft.Storage.MultiStorageAcco.description: A group of controls for creating several storage accounts with names that start with a common prefix.

Views.Microsoft.Storage.StorageAccountSe.description: The control enables the user to create a new storage account or select an existing storage account.

Views.Microsoft.Storage.StorageBlobSelec.description: A control for selecting a blob from an Azure storage account.
